class VersionManager[source]

VersionManager(*args, **kwargs) :: Lookup

{% endraw %}

Version.objects.get

Get an instance of a version object, if it exists.

Version.objects.get(project_id=None, version=None))

Arguments

  • project_id (string). required. An id related to one of your Projects.
  • version (interger). required. Any given version number.

Usage 

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
version_obj = Version.objects.get(project_id=project_id, version=version)

or

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
project_obj = Porject.objects.get(project_id=project_id)
version_obj = project_obj.get_version(version=version)

or

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
version_obj, created = Version.objects.get_or_create(project_id=project_id, version=version)

Version.objects.all

Get the list of versions for a project_id.

Version.objects.all(project_id=None))

Arguments

  • project_id (string). required. An id related to one of your Projects.

Usage 

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
version_list = Version.objects.all(project_id=project_id)

or

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
project_obj = Porject.objects.get(project_id=project_id)
version_list = project_obj.get_versions()

Version.objects.get_latest

Get the latest created version for a project_id.

Version.objects.get_latest(project_id=None))

Arguments

  • project_id (string). required. An id related to one of your Projects.

Usage 

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
version_obj = Version.objects.get_latest(project_id=project_id)

or

version = 1
project_id = 'your-project-id'
project_obj = Porject.objects.get(project_id=project_id)
version_list = project_obj.latest()

class Version[source]

Version(*args, **kwargs) :: Lookup

An individual release of any given project.

{% endraw %}

push

Pushes your code (and related files) into production.

version_obj.push(path="/path/to/local/project")

Arguments

  • path (string). required. Default ("."). A local path to your project. Requires entry.py to be at the root of path otherwise push will not work.

Usage 

import pathlib

# set your own version here
version = <your-version>
project_id = <your-project-id>

# get a version
version_obj = Version.objects.get(project_id=project_id, version=version)

# local path
local_dir = pathlib.Path("/path/to/your/local/project") 

current_dir = "." # this will use the current directory

version_obj.push(local_dir)

status

Get the status of your version object.

version_obj.status()

Arguments

  • None

Usage 

import pathlib

# set your own version here
version = <your-version>
project_id = <your-project-id>

# get a version
version_obj = Version.objects.get(project_id=project_id, version=version)


version_obj.status()

open

Opens a Project Version instance's url, if it exists.

version_obj.open()

Arguments

  • None

Usage 

import pathlib

# set your own version here
version = <your-version>
project_id = <your-project-id>

# get a version
version_obj = Version.objects.get(project_id=project_id, version=version)


version_obj.open()
